channel.title: Chapter 22: Git More Collaboration :: Introduction to Web Dev
channel.description: Learning Objectives After completing all the content in this chapter, you should be able to do the following: Gain a deeper understanding of what Git is and why programmers use it. Work with Git to version control personal work. Learn how Git can be used to manage teamwork. Key Terminology Here is a list of key terms in this chapter broken down by the page the term first appears on. As you read through this chapter, make note of these terms and their definitions.

item.title: Reading
item.description: What is Git? Repositories and Commits Remote Repositories Branches Merging in Git

item.title: Exercises: Git
item.description: We will use our new terminal powers to move through the Git exercises. In whichever directory you are keeping your coursework outside of javascript-projects, make a new directory called Git-Exercises using the mkdir command. You want to make sure this is outside of javascript-projects because it will cause an issue if you try and make a new Git repository inside an existing one. Check your solution My-Computer:my-coursework myusername$ mkdir Git-Exercises

item.title: Studio: Communication Log
item.description: Task 1: Getting Started Task 2: Time to Communicate!

item.title: Next Steps
item.description: You are now ready to tackle the DOM. Before moving on to the next chapter, if you would like additional resources on Git, here are a few of our favorites. Linux Basics Git Commands Documentation
